values.name: Red Cross
values.desc: The American Red Cross, also known as the American National Red Cross, is a humanitarian organization that provides emergency assistance, disaster relief and education in the United States.

values.name: Hope For Haiti
values.desc: We work to improve the quality of life for the Haitian people, particularly children.

values.name: Feeding America
values.desc: Feeding America is a hunger organization with a nationwide network of food banks feeding the hungry.

values.name: Salvation Army
values.desc: The Salvation Army is a Christian church and international charitable organisation structured in a quasi-military fashion.

values.name: YMCA
values.desc: YMCA programs celebrate and honor common values of respect, responsibility, honesty, and caring by infusing character development into programs.

values.name: United Way
values.desc: United Way Worldwide is the leadership and support organization for the network of nearly 1,800 community-based United Ways in 45 countries and territories.

values.name: American Civil Liberties Union
values.desc: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) is a national organization that works daily in courts, legislatures and communities to defend the individual rights of the people.

values.name: Asian Americans Advancing Justice
values.desc: A non-profit legal aid and civil rights organization dedicated to advocating for civil rights, providing legal services and education for APAs

values.name: Wounded Warrior Project
values.desc: Wounded Warrior Project is a charity and veterans service organization that offers a variety of programs for wounded veterans of the military actions following 9/11.

values.name: Doctors Without Borders
values.desc: Doctors Without Borders, is an international humanitarian-aid non-governmental organization.

values.name: Cancer Research Institute
values.desc: The Cancer Research Institute (CRI) is the world's only nonprofit leader dedicated exclusively to advancing immunology and immunotherapy against cancer.

values.name: National Rifle Association
values.desc: Support of a wide range of firearm-related public interest activities of the National Rifle Association of America and other organizations.

values.name: Union of Concerned Scientists
values.desc: Puts rigorous independent science to work to solve the most pressing problems of our planet.

values.name: Hispanic Scholarship Fund
values.desc: Providing the Hispanic community and other minorities college scholarships and educational outreach support.

values.name: Coalition for the Homeless
values.desc: To assist the homeless through its programs for advocacy, AIDS, housing, and job training, while providing decent shelter, sufficient food, affordable housing, and job placement.

values.name: Habitat for Humanity
values.desc: Seeking to put God's love into action, brings people together to build homes, communities and hope.

values.name: Africare
values.desc: Works to improve the quality of life of the people in Africa by building partnerships with African people to build sustainable, healthy and productive lives and communities, and is a leading voice in addressing African development and policy issues.

values.name: NAMI
values.desc: Dedicated to improving the lives of persons and their families living with serious mental illness.

values.name: International Peace Institute
values.desc: Dedicated to promoting the prevention and settlement of conflicts between and within states by strengthening international peace and security institutions.

values.name: Center for Reproductive Rights
values.desc: Legal advocacy organization dedicated to promoting and defending women's reproductive rights worldwide; uses the law to advance reproductive freedom as a fundamental human right that all governments are legally obligated to protect.

values.name: Fisher House Foundation
values.desc: Provides military families housing close to a loved one during hospitalization for an illness, disease or injury; also funds a scholarship program for military families, and provides military personnel and their families with free air travel and hotel rooms.

values.name: Semper Fi Fund
values.desc: Provides immediate and long-term support for post-9/11 injured and critically ill members of the U.S. Armed Forces and their families.

values.name: Breast Cancer Fund
values.desc: Working to stop breast cancer before it starts by exposing and eliminating the environmental causes of the disease.
